questions.text: The length of a rectangular field is 60 m and breadth is 40 m. What is the area of the field?
questions.explanation:
Given: Length (l) = 60 m, Breadth (b) = 40 m

Area of rectangle = l × b
Area = 60 × 40
Area = 2400 m²

Therefore, the area of the rectangular field is 2400 m².

Note: Area is always expressed in square units (m², cm², km², etc.).

questions.text: The radius of a circular garden is 21 m. What is the area of the garden? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation:
Given: Radius (r) = 21 m, π = 22/7

Area of circle = πr²
Area = (22/7) × 21 × 21
Area = (22/7) × 441
Area = 22 × 63
Area = 1386 m²

Tip: When radius is a multiple of 7 (like 7, 14, 21, 28), use π = 22/7 for easy calculation.

Therefore, the area of the circular garden is 1386 m².

questions.text: A cylindrical pillar has a radius of 3.5 m and height of 12 m. What is the curved surface area of the pillar? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation:
Given: Radius (r) = 3.5 m, Height (h) = 12 m, π = 22/7

Curved Surface Area (CSA) = 2πrh

CSA = 2 × (22/7) × 3.5 × 12

Note: 3.5 = 7/2, so:
CSA = 2 × (22/7) × (7/2) × 12
CSA = 2 × 22 × (1/2) × 12
CSA = 22 × 12
CSA = 264 m²

Therefore, the curved surface area is 264 m².
